intro: Corydalis kolpakowskiana var. hennigii, commonly known as the Hennig's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and ornamental value, it is a sought-after species among horticulturists and botanists.
